10-50x faster than Louvain but lower quality

research_topics.title: Graph Search Libraries
key_findings: NetworkX is the default choice for 90% of projects - ease of use dominates
rustworkx offers best balance of performance + permissive license (Apache-2.0)
graph-tool is fastest but has high installation complexity and LGPL license
igraph is best for cross-platform projects (R integration) but lacks A*
scipy.csgraph is best for SciPy stack users but lacks A* and graph objects
Python is production tool for data science, prototyping tool for games/robotics
A* requires heuristic - not always better than Dijkstra
Performance matters less than ecosystem fit for most projects

research_topics.title: Similarity Search Libraries
key_findings: FAISS is the production standard for dense vector search (RAG, embeddings)
Annoy is optimal for <10M vectors - simplest API, fastest to prototype
ScaNN achieves best accuracy (>98% recall) for inner-product metrics
datasketch is the go-to for set similarity (MinHash) and deduplication (SimHash)
All libraries optimize for batch index builds, not real-time updates
GPU acceleration (FAISS, ScaNN) provides 100x+ speedup for large-scale datasets
Choice depends on data type: dense vectors (FAISS/Annoy/ScaNN) vs sets (datasketch)
Annoy → FAISS is common migration path as scale increases

research_topics.title: Community Detection Libraries
key_findings: Leiden is production standard - fixes Louvain's disconnected communities defect
Leiden is faster than Louvain despite extra refinement phase (20x on 39M nodes)
Louvain suitable for prototyping only - migrate to Leiden before production
Infomap excels on directed/weighted/temporal/multiplex networks via information theory
Label Propagation (NetworKit) is only algorithm that scales to >10M nodes
Spectral Clustering is deterministic but O(n³) limits to <50K nodes
CDlib provides unified API to 39+ algorithms for comparison and research
All modularity methods are non-deterministic except Spectral (cluster_qr)
Quality guarantees matter - Leiden guarantees connected communities (0% disconnected vs 16% for Louvain)
Algorithm selection depends on graph type: directed→Infomap, undirected→Leiden, huge→Label Prop

research_topics.title: String Matching Libraries
key_findings: RapidFuzz is the de facto standard for fuzzy matching (83M monthly downloads)
Jellyfish is the only option for phonetic matching (Soundex, Metaphone)
pyahocorasick excels at finding thousands of patterns simultaneously
regex library offers 160M monthly downloads as drop-in re replacement
google-re2 provides linear-time guarantee for security-critical applications
Standard library (re, difflib, str methods) sufficient for simple cases
Choose specialized tools based on use case: fuzzy vs exact vs phonetic
MIT and BSD licenses dominate (permissive for commercial use)
